required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety and Efficacy Study of a Recombinant Fusion Protein Linking Coagulation Factor IX With Albumin (rIX-FP) in Patients With Hemophilia B
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II/III Open-label, Multicenter, Safety and Efficacy Study of a Recombinant Coagulation Factor IX Albumin Fusion Protein (rIX-FP) in Subjects With Hemophilia B

brief_summary.textblock: This study will examine the safety, pharmacokinetics and efficacy of rIX-FP for the control and prevention of bleeding episodes in subjects who have previously received factor replacement therapy for hemophilia B.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Frequency of Spontaneous Bleeding Events Between On-demand and Prophylaxis Treatments (Annualized)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 26 weeks for on-demand regimen, and between 1 and 17 months for prophylaxis regimen.
primary_outcome.description: Subjects in the on-demand arm received on-demand dosing with rIX-FP for up to 26 weeks (on-demand regimen), and then received weekly prophylaxis with rIX-FP for the remainder of the study (prophylaxis regimen). The effectiveness of prophylaxis in comparison to on-demand therapy was investigated by comparing the same subject's annualized spontaneous bleeding rate (AsBR) during the on-demand regimen and during the prophylaxis regimen.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Developing Inhibitors Against Factor IX (FIX)
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants developing inhibitors against factor IX (FIX) along with the 95% Clopper-Pearson confidence interval, are summarized for subjects with 50 or more exposure days (EDs) to rIX-FP, and for all participants in the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Frequency of Related Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: For the duration of the study; median 20.27 months.
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants experiencing treatment-related adverse-events (TEAEs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Developing Antibodies Against rIX-FP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: For the duration of the study; median 20.27 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Bleeding Episodes Requiring One or ≤ Two Injections of rIX-FP to Achieve Hemostasis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: For the duration of the study; median 20.27 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of injections required to achieve hemostasis expressed as a percentage of the bleeding episodes requiring treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Investigator's Overall Clinical Assessment of Hemostatic Efficacy for Treatment of Bleeding Episodes, Based on a Four Point Ordinal Scales (Excellent, Good, Moderate, Poor/No Response)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: For the duration of the study; median 20.27 months
secondary_outcome.description: Number of bleeding episodes requiring treatment that resulted in hemostatic efficacy of excellent, good, moderate, poor/no response, according to the Investigator's clinical assessment of hemostatic efficacy, expressed as a percentage of the bleeding episodes requiring treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: rIX-FP Consumed Per Month While Maintaining Assigned Prophylactic Treatment Interval During Routine Prophylaxis.
secondary_outcome.description: Time frame: For Prophylaxis Arm 7-, 10- and 14-day regimens, median 269, 240 and 386 days respectively. For On-demand Arm, prophylaxis regimen, median 316 days.
Pharmacokinetic (PK) data are presented for a single 50 IU/kg dose of rIX-FP.

secondary_outcome.measure: Half-life (t1/2) of a Single Dose of rIX-FP
secondary_outcome.description: PK data are presented for a single 50 IU/kg dose of rIX-FP.
AUC to the last sample with quantifiable drug concentration (AUClast) of a single dose of rIX-FP. PK data are presented for a single 50 IU/kg dose of rIX-FP.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clearance of a Single Dose of rIX-FP
secondary_outcome.description: PK data are presented for a single 50 IU/kg dose of rIX-FP.

secondary_outcome.measure: Investigator's (or Surgeon's) Overall Clinical Assessment of Hemostatic Efficacy for Surgical Prophylaxis, Based on a Four Point Ordinal Scale (Excellent, Good, Moderate, Poor/No Response)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of surgical events treated prophylactically with rIX-FP that resulted in hemostatic efficacy of excellent, good, moderate, poor/no response, according to the Investigator's (surgeon's) overall assessment of hemostatic efficacy for surgical prophylaxis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized Spontaneous Bleeding Events Compared Between 7 Day Prophylactic and Extended Regimens
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During treatment, between median 240 and 386 days per subject.
secondary_outcome.description: Median number of spontaneous bleeds per year per subject comparing 7-, 10- and 14- day prophylactic regimens.

arm_group.description: Routine weekly prophylaxis and episodic treatment for bleeding episodes. An individualized dosing interval may be tested in sub-group subjects during the 2nd part of the trial. Subjects may participate in a surgical 'sub-study' in which rIX-FP may be administered prior to, during and after surgical intervention.

Episodic treatment for bleeding episodes during the first 6 months then switch to routine weekly prophylaxis for a further 6 months Subjects may participate in a surgical 'sub-study' in which rIX-FP may be administered prior to, during and after surgical intervention.

intervention.description: Recombinant IX-FP (rIX-FP) is a fusion protein linking coagulation factor IX with albumin, and will be administered by intravenous administration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male subjects, 12 to 65 years old
- Severe hemophilia B (FIX activity of ≤ 2%)
- Subjects who have received FIX products (plasma-derived and/or recombinant FIX) for > 150 exposure days (EDs)
- No history of FIX inhibitor formation, no detectable inhibitors at Screening and no family history of inhibitors against FIX
- Written informed consent for study participation
- On-demand subjects only, who have experienced a minimum average of 2 non-trauma induced bleeding episodes requiring treatment with a FIX product during the previous 6 or 3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to any FIX product or hamster protein
- Known congenital or acquired coagulation disorder other than congenital FIX deficiency
- HIV positive subjects with a CD4 count < 200/mm3
- Low platelet count, kidney or liver dysfunction
- Recent life-threatening bleeding episode

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were enrolled from 30 sites in 10 countries.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 69 subjects provided informed consent and were screened for study participation. Of these, 63 subjects were enrolled and treated with rIX-FP.

group.title: Prophylaxis
group.description: Routine weekly prophylaxis and episodic treatment for bleeding episodes. An individualized dosing interval may be tested in sub-group subjects during the 2nd part of the trial. Subjects may participate in a surgical ’sub-study’ in which rIX-FP may be administered prior to, during and after surgical intervention.

group.title: On-demand
group.description: Episodic treatment for bleeding episodes for up to 26 weeks then switch to routine weekly prophylaxis for the remainder of the study. Subjects may participate in a surgical ’sub-study’ in which rIX-FP may be administered prior to, during and after surgical intervention.

group.title: Prophylaxis
group.description: Routine weekly prophylaxis and episodic treatment for bleeding episodes. An individualized dosing interval may be tested in sub-group subjects during the 2nd part of the trial. group.description: Episodic treatment for bleeding episodes for up to 26 weeks then switch to routine weekly prophylaxis for the remainder of the study. Subjects may participate in a surgical ’sub-study’ in which rIX-FP may be administered prior to, during and after surgical intervention. rIX-FP: Recombinant IX-FP (rIX-FP) is a fusion protein linking coagulation factor IX with albumin, and will be administered by intravenous administration

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change in Frequency of Spontaneous Bleeding Events Between On-demand and Prophylaxis Treatments (Annualized)
outcome.description: Subjects in the on-demand arm received on-demand dosing with rIX-FP for up to 26 weeks (on-demand regimen), and then received weekly prophylaxis with rIX-FP for the remainder of the study (prophylaxis regimen). The effectiveness of prophylaxis in comparison to on-demand therapy was investigated by comparing the same subject’s annualized spontaneous bleeding rate (AsBR) during the on-demand regimen and during the prophylaxis regimen.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 26 weeks for on-demand regimen, and between 1 and 17 months for prophylaxis regimen.
outcome.population: This analysis includes only the participants assigned to the on-demand arm who received at least 1 dose of rIX-FP in the on-demand regimen and at least 1 dose of rIX-FP in the prophylaxis regimen.

group.title: On-demand Arm, On-demand Regimen
group.description: Participants in the On-demand Arm, when receiving episodic treatment for bleeding episodes (on-demand regimen).

group.title: On-demand Arm, Prophylaxis Regimen
group.description: Participants in the On-demand Arm, when receiving routine weekly prophylaxis (prophylaxis regimen).

measure.title: Change in Frequency of Spontaneous Bleeding Events Between On-demand and Prophylaxis Treatments (Annualized)
measure.description: Subjects in the on-demand arm received on-demand dosing with rIX-FP for up to 26 weeks (on-demand regimen), and then received weekly prophylaxis with rIX-FP for the remainder of the study (prophylaxis regimen). The effectiveness of prophylaxis in comparison to on-demand therapy was investigated by comparing the same subject’s annualized spontaneous bleeding rate (AsBR) during the on-demand regimen and during the prophylaxis regimen.
measure.population: This analysis includes only the participants assigned to the on-demand arm who received at least 1 dose of rIX-FP in the on-demand regimen and at least 1 dose of rIX-FP in the prophylaxis regimen.

analysis.groups_desc: A test of null hypothesis that the ratio of AsBR (prophylaxis regimen/on-demand regimen) was ≥ 0.50 was conducted at the 1-sided 0.025 level. Matched pairs design with 19 subjects and 2 observations per subject.
analysis.p_value_desc: P value is based on a Wilcoxon signed-rank test of H0: AsBR ratio (prophylaxis regimen/on-demand regimen) ≥ 0.50. The ratio was based on the original scale.

outcome.title: Incremental Recovery of rIX-FP
outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) data are presented for a single 50 IU/kg dose of rIX-FP.
outcome.population: The PK population comprised 46 subjects who received at least 1 dose of rIX-FP at 50 IU/kg. Data are presented for subjects from the PK population who had a sufficient number of analyzable PK samples for evaluation of the PK profile of rIX-FP.

outcome.title: Investigator’s (or Surgeon’s) Overall Clinical Assessment of Hemostatic Efficacy for Surgical Prophylaxis, Based on a Four Point Ordinal Scale (Excellent, Good, Moderate, Poor/No Response)
outcome.description: Number of surgical events treated prophylactically with rIX-FP that resulted in hemostatic efficacy of excellent, good, moderate, poor/no response, according to the Investigator’s (surgeon’s) overall assessment of hemostatic efficacy for surgical prophylaxis.

group.title: Surgical Population
group.description: The Surgical population consisted of 3 subjects in the prophylaxis arm and 1 subject in the on demand arm who received at least 1 dose of rIX FP for a major or minor surgical procedure.

measure.title: Investigator’s (or Surgeon’s) Overall Clinical Assessment of Hemostatic Efficacy for Surgical Prophylaxis, Based on a Four Point Ordinal Scale (Excellent, Good, Moderate, Poor/No Response)

outcome.description: Median number of spontaneous bleeds per year per subject comparing 7-, 10- and 14- day prophylactic regimens.

reported_events.time_frame: For the duration of the study, up to 27.7 months.
reported_events.desc: The Safety analysis population consisted of subjects who received at least 1 dose of rIX-FP during the study. Adverse Event (AE) data are treatment-emergent data unless otherwise noted. The total number of participants in the number affected by Other (non-serious) AEs, is the total number of participants experiencing at least one non-serious AE.

group.title: Prophylaxis
group.description: Routine weekly prophylaxis and episodic treatment for bleeding episodes. An individualized dosing interval may be tested in sub-group subjects during the 2nd part of the trial. Subjects may participate in a surgical ’sub-study’ in which rIX-FP may be administered prior to, during and after surgical intervention.

event.description: This serious adverse event was not treatment-emergent.
This serious adverse event was not treatment-emergent.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: CSL agreements and restrictions on publishing may vary with individual investigators; however, CSL will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. CSL supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial and generally requires that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
